etymologies: mid 19th century (in an earlier sense). From French phorone from -phor- (in post-classical Latin camphora) + French -one)

definitions: A yellowish-green crystalline ketone, isomeric with camphorone, obtained by a condensation reaction of acetone; 2,6-dimethyl-2,5-heptadien-4-one, (CH₃)₂ C=CHCOCH=C(CH₃)₂.
